intro: Maieta setosissima, commonly known as the hairy maieta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, yellowish to reddish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
